p: Additionally, we utilized the NDVI component of the UHRI as a separate measure of vegetation abundance in May and September to isolate the role of greenspace in heat mitigation. The NDVI is a robust indicator that is readily calculable from multispectral imagery [58,59]. It has been used in prior environmental exposure studies as a proxy for the distribution of urban greenspace [60,61], and as an indicator of vegetation abundance in the analysis of green biomass and urban greenspace [62,63]. A separate analysis of NDVI became useful in the case of Delhi due to the specific geography of greenspace here, consisting of forested and riverine areas in the central and eastern parts, and agricultural land uses in the urban peripheries to the north and west.
